channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-13509] NullPointerException in JSON Facet if omitHeaders=true
item.description:
The error exists in Solr 8.1.1 and didn't occur in Solr 8.0 and 7.x.

Running this simple JSON Facet against the techproducts example (in cloud mode) succeeds as expected:

curl http://localhost:8983/solr/techproducts/select -d '
q=*:*&
omitHeader=false&
json.facet={
  "max_price" : "max(price)"
}

But as soon you omit Headers it results in a NullPointerException (which didn't happen in earlier Solr versions):

curl http://localhost:8983/solr/techproducts/select -d '
q=*:*&
omitHeader=true&
json.facet={
  "max_price" : "max(price)"
}'

Exception:

2019-06-03 12:40:11.446 ERROR (qtp67730604-361) [c:techproducts s:shard2 r:core_node7 x:techproducts_shard2_replica_n4] o.a.s.h.RequestHandlerBase java.lang.NullPointerException

item.environment:
Solr 8.1.1 downloaded tar gz, started in cloud mode:

bin/solr start -e cloud -noprompt
bin/solr create -c techproducts -s 2 -rf 2 -d server/solr/configsets/sample_techproducts_configs/conf -n sample_techproducts_configs
bin/post -c techproducts example/exampledocs/*.xml
item.summary: NullPointerException in JSON Facet if omitHeaders=true

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I think this is caused by SOLR-9882

SOLR-13509.patch
Simple test demonstrating the problem(this test needs to be moved to better place). This is throwing the NPE as omitHeader is set to true. Here, facets are checked but stats are not checked(I think it would be difficult do it)

Initially thought adding null check here would be suffice but what about other component?? Should the shardRequest always ask for responseHeader irrespective of omitHeader?

SOLR-13509.patch
Corrected the test. Here, Always fetching response from the shards. Making sure that responseHeader is not returned to the user when omitHeade=true
I'm not sure if the test has been added in the right place.
mkhludnev
Could you please review above approach?? Would this approach solve the issue or anything else needs to be done here??

Right, this was introduced by SOLR-9882. I suppose it's worth to randomly omit header at CloudExitableDirectoryReaderTest.testCreepThenBite. I'm not sure whether it safe (but it should) always request header for subordinate requests. Shouldn't FacetModule.handleResponses just bypass if response's header is absent?

Shouldn't FacetModule.handleResponses just bypass if response's header is absent?

Initially thought of adding null check in FacetModule would suffice but won't the same issue occur in other components (Eg: FacetComponent). Also, For proper partial response handling and its metrics, responseHeader is important.
For users using timeAllowed with omitHeader=true, will the timeout metrics be correct if responseHeader is not fetched from each shard? I'm still not sure if SearchHandler is right place to override omitHeader. Correct me If I'm wrong, timeAllowed is supported only in case of SearchHandler right?? Is partial results possible in other cases too?

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
I think your points are all correct. I suppose we don't care anything beyond of SearchHandler.

SOLR-13509.patch
patch with some no-commit

  • Fixes the failing test case in Distributed debug component. Should the behavior be changed so that we return Qtime in debug irrespective of omitHeader=true or not? For now, adding QTime only when omitHeader=false and responseHeader!=null (current behavior)
  • I have made changes in CloudExitableDirectoryReaderTest.testCreepThenBite to randomly omitHeader as suggested. when omitHeader=true, we won't be able to verify if it is partial result or not. The test verifies that request doesn't fail with any NPE, need suggestions to improve this further
  • Also, Documentation need to be updated for timeAllowed(partial results) and omitHeader=true, if not already covered. With this combination, user wouldn't if it is partial result or not

Approach-2

  • CloudExitableDirectoryReaderTest.testCreepThenBite also covers query case but there is no NPE being thrown as null check is done . This could be done for FacetComponent and FacetModule too (only other components with support for timeAllowed) but then for any component which adds support for partial results, null check has to be explicitly added

mkhludnev
Please suggest which would be a better approach

For now, adding QTime only when omitHeader=false and responseHeader!=null (current behavior)

I just would disagree with assert. imho omitting header has nothing related to debug response body. 

Regarding testCreepThenBite, I think creeping can be done without omitting header, and only for biting we need to omit randomly. Breaking on bite phase might lead to shallow coverage.  

Agree, regarding documentation. 

I'd like the initial approach of requesting header for shard searches. Existing null checks are bad legacy we hardly need to deal with.  

Thank you so much. Sadly, I'm not able to put more effort for fixing the bug I introduced.

-1 overall

SOLR-13509.patch

I just would disagree with assert. imho omitting header has nothing related to debug response body.

This is done. I have modified the assertion in the test

Regarding testCreepThenBite, I think creeping can be done without omitting header, and only for biting we need to omit randomly. Breaking on bite phase might lead to shallow coverage.

Removed randomness from creep phase and added it to bite phase.

Agree, regarding documentation.

I will make these changes once patch is finalized

I dropped a few null check for shards response header, and comments in code, since I remember something discouraging comments in code conventions; updated ref guide; shorten DDebugTest . WDYT munendrasn?

mkhludnev
Changes LGTM

Commit 5ba6c0c7a2ed71fef321abee6b0fee13d93ea183 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Mikhail Khludnev
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=5ba6c0c ]

SOLR-13509: add omitHeader=false for shards requests to avoid NPE on partialResuls check

Commit 5f6df28e111fc5a2af8c5706ba65ccbd6e1be444 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/branch_8x from Mikhail Khludnev
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=5f6df28 ]

SOLR-13509: add omitHeader=false for shards requests to avoid NPE on partialResuls check
Thanks, mkalkbrenner and munendrasn

mkhludnev
Thanks for merging this.
There are plans for 8.1.2. So, should this change be ported to branch_8_1 too?? Also, mkalkbrenner's name is missing from Changes entry

Hmm, I don't think it deserve pitching into 8.1.2, because it has easy workaround: omitHeader=true. But you can propose it in the corresponding  thread. Regarding Changes entry, afaik only contributor and committer deserves mentioning, reporter just gets much respect.
Closing after the 8.2.0 release
